text: Arnica lessingii is a Russian and North American species of arnica in the sunflower family. The common name is nodding arnica.Flora of North America Vol. 21 Page 369 Nodding arnica, Arnica lessingii (Torrey & A. Gray) Greene It is found on both sides of the Bering Strait, being native to Alaska, Yukon, British Columbia, Northwest Territories, and the Kamchatka Peninsula of the Pacific Coast of Russia.Biota of North America Program 2014 state-level distribution map ==References== lessingii Category:Flora of Subarctic America Category:Flora of the Russian Far East
title: Arnica lessingii
